skill.name: claude-skills
skill.description: Claude Skills meta-skill: extract domain material (docs/APIs/code/specs) into a reusable Skill (SKILL.md + references/scripts/assets), and refactor existing Skills for clarity, activation reliability, and quality gates.

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation and scaffolding meta-skill. All code (2 shell scripts) uses only POSIX tools (bash, sed, awk, grep, find) with no network access, no credential handling, and no dangerous operations. Filesystem access is limited to reading SKILL.md and creating new skill directories in user-specified output paths. Safe to publish.

content.value_statement: Turning scattered domain material into reusable, maintainable Skills requires structure and quality gates. This meta-skill provides templates, validation scripts, and workflows to build Skills that activate reliably and include navigable references.
actual_capabilities: Create new Skills from docs, APIs, code, or specs using templates
Validate Skill structure against the specification
Refactor existing Skills for clarity and reliability
Generate minimal or complete skill scaffolding
Enforce quality gates with the validation script
Organize content into references/ with navigation index
limitations: Does not create domain content for you (only structure and templates)
Does not access external APIs or execute arbitrary code
Does not modify existing Skills without explicit user request
Requires user to provide domain material and examples

use_cases.title: Structure Technical Docs
use_cases.description: Transform API documentation or tech specs into reusable Skills with copy/paste patterns and examples.

use_cases.title: Build Custom Skills
use_cases.description: Create production-grade Skills from your internal tools, workflows, or domain expertise.

use_cases.title: Validate Before Submitting
use_cases.description: Run the quality gate and validator to ensure Skills meet community standards before publishing.

prompt_templates.title: Scaffold New Skill
prompt_templates.scenario: Create a minimal skill from domain docs
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the claude-skills meta-skill to create a new skill called [skill-name]. The domain material is [describe your docs/specs]. Generate a minimal scaffold with template-minimal.md as the SKILL.md template.

prompt_templates.title: Full Skill Scaffold
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the claude-skills meta-skill to generate a full skill scaffold for [domain]. Include all reference files (getting_started.md, api.md, examples.md, troubleshooting.md). The target output directory is [path].

prompt_templates.title: Validate Existing Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the validate-skill.sh script in strict mode on [skill-directory]. Report any warnings or errors and suggest fixes for each issue found.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor Long Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze [existing-skill]/SKILL.md and identify content that belongs in references/. Move long-form documentation into appropriate reference files, create references/index.md, and keep Quick Reference as copy/paste patterns only.

output_examples.input: Use the claude-skills meta-skill to create a new skill called my-api with a minimal template in the skills directory.
output: 2) Put long-form docs into skills/my-api/references/ and update index.md

best_practices: Use decidable triggers in the frontmatter description: state what the skill does and when to use it with concrete keywords.
Keep Quick Reference as short, copy/paste patterns (under 20 when possible); move long explanations to references/.
Always include 3+ reproducible examples with input, steps, and expected acceptance criteria.
anti_patterns: Documentation dumps in Quick Reference: users cannot scan or reuse pasted docs.
Vague activation like 'helps with X' without concrete triggers leads to unreliable activation.
Missing 'Not For / Boundaries' section causes the skill to fire in irrelevant contexts.

faq.question: What platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This meta-skill works with Claude, Claude Code, and Codex. The Skills you create are portable across all three.

faq.question: What is the minimum required for a Skill?
faq.answer: A single SKILL.md file with YAML frontmatter (name and description) is the minimum viable Skill.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with CI/CD?
faq.answer: Yes. Run scripts/validate-skill.sh in CI with --strict to enforce quality gates on every commit.

faq.question: Does this skill send data anywhere?
faq.answer: No. All scripts use only POSIX tools and work entirely offline. No network calls are made.

faq.question: Why does my Skill not trigger?
faq.answer: Check that your frontmatter description has concrete trigger keywords and that 'When to Use This Skill' lists specific tasks.

faq.question: How is this different from skill-creator?
faq.answer: This meta-skill includes templates, validation, quality checklists, and anti-patterns for production-grade Skill development.
